file_summary: This Java class, `VetControllerTests`, is a unit test for the `VetController` in the Spring PetClinic application. It utilizes Spring Boot's `@WebMvcTest` annotation to focus on testing the web layer, specifically the MVC endpoints handled by `VetController`. The class mocks the `VetRepository` using `@MockitoBean` to control its behavior during tests. It sets up mock data for veterinarians (James and Helen) and configures the `VetRepository` mock to return this data when `findAll()` methods are called. The tests verify two main functionalities: displaying the list of vets in an HTML view (checked via `/vets.html?page=1` endpoint) and providing the list of vets as a JSON REST endpoint (checked via `/vets` endpoint with `application/json` acceptance). It ensures correct HTTP status, model attributes, view names, and JSON content.
